channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Trump administration just took a big step toward considering crypto assets during home loan applications
item.description: The directive is “in keeping with President Trump’s vision to make the United States the crypto capital of the world.”

item.title: 10 Years After the Supreme Court Legalized Same-Sex Marriage Nationwide, Here’s What Couples Think
item.description: A decade after the Supreme Court legalized same-sex marriage nationwide, we asked people from across the country to share stories of what the ruling i...

item.title: How Sandwiches in Canada’s Lloydminster Became a Test for Domestic Trade
item.description: A city that straddles two Canadian provinces became a crucible of the barriers that prevent trade across Canada and that Prime Minister Mark Carney wa...

item.title: Tanner Martin Announces His Own Death
item.description: Tanner Martin has documented his fight against colon cancer for hundreds of thousands of followers. His death was announced in a recorded video.

item.title: Why this former OpenAI researcher thinks it’s time to start gaming out AI’s future
item.description: Former OpenAI safety researcher Steven Adler explains why simulating AI’s rise could help us prepare.

item.title: Republicans are scrambling after learning their proposed cuts to Medicaid, which would offset trillions in tax breaks, violate Senate rules
item.description: It's a major blow to Trump's "big, beautiful" spending bill.

item.title: Conservatives and environmentalists say carbon capture is unnecessarily expensive and fails to curb pollution effectively. Here’s what the science says
item.description: Carbon capture and sequestration is seen by many as an important way to reduce pollution during a transition to renewable energy.

item.title: Crypto Industry Moves Into the U.S. Housing Market
item.description: Americans are finding ways to use digital currencies to help them buy homes, and new companies are forming to help people tap their home’s value to bu...

item.title: Fortnite players can cash in on another $126 million in refunds after being ‘tricked’ into unwanted purchases—here’s how
item.description: The refunds are part of a $520 million settlement that Epic agreed to pay back in 2022.

item.title: RFK Jr.’s New Advisers Rescind Recommendations for Some Flu Vaccines
item.description: Panelists pulled back some endorsements for certain vaccines containing a preservative that critics have falsely linked to autism.

item.title: Debris From SpaceX Explosion, Landing in Mexico, Draws Investigation
item.description: Mexican environmental activists say detritus raining down from Elon Musk’s rocket company has caused die-offs of marine life.

item.title: Ecuador Captures Gang Leader ‘Fito’ Whose Prison Escape Set Off Violence
